intro: Aphelandra lingua-bovis, commonly known as the bovine tongue plant, is a striking member of the Marantaceae family native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its long, strap-like, dark green leaves that resemble a tongue, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish. Aphelandra lingua-bovis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
